question: Two metal balls are the same size but one weighs twice as much as the other. The balls are dropped from the roof of a single story building at the same instant of time. What is the time it takes the balls to reach the ground?
rationale: The time it takes the balls to reach the ground below will be about the same for both balls.
wrong 1: The time it takes the balls to reach the ground below will be about half as long for the heavier ball as for the lighter one.
wrong 2: The time it takes the balls to reach the ground below will be about half as long for the lighter ball as for the heavier one.
wrong 3: The time it takes the balls to reach the ground below will be considerably less for the heavier ball, but not necessarily half as long.
wrong 4: The time it takes the balls to reach the ground below will be considerably less for the lighter ball, but not necessarily half as long.

question: A large truck collides head-on with a small compact car. During the collision, what is the relationship between the forces exerted by one object on the other?
rationale: During the collision the truck exerts the same amount of force on the car as the car exerts on the truck.
wrong 1: During the collision the truck exerts a greater amount of force on the car than the car exerts on the truck.
wrong 2: During the collision the car exerts a greater amount of force on the truck than the truck exerts on the car.
wrong 3: During the collision neither exerts a force on the other, the car gets smashed simply because it gets in the way of the truck.
wrong 4: During the collision the truck exerts a force on the car but the car does not exert a force on the truck.

question: What happens to a stone dropped from the roof of a single story building to the surface of the earth?
rationale: The stone speeds up because of an almost constant force of gravity acting upon it.
wrong 1: The stone reaches a maximum speed quite soon after release and then falls at a constant speed thereafter.
wrong 2: The stone speeds up as it falls because the gravitational attraction gets considerably stronger as the stone gets closer to the earth.
wrong 3: The stone falls because of the natural tendency of all objects to rest on the surface of the earth.
wrong 4: Tne stone falls because of the combined effects of the force of gravity pushing it downward and the force of the air pushing it downward.
